newsitem.title: UK: Sainsbury launches its j-v bank.
newsitem.headline: Sainsbury launches its j-v bank.

text.p: British supermarket group J. Sainsbury Plc launched its Sainsbury's Bank joint venture with Bank of Scotland on Wednesday.
The bank will initially be a telephone banking service operating 24 hours a day and will offer two credit cards and two savings accounts, Sainsbury said in a statement.
It will be supported by a network of cash machines and telephone information centres throughout the stores.
Sainsbury's Bank will kick off in the north of England and the Midlands, rolling out nationally over the next few months, the statement said.
The joint venture, in which Sainsbury holds 55 percent and Bank of Scotland 45 percent, was first announced in October 1996.
It was the first banking venture by a supermarket but similar link-ups have since been announced by Tesco and Royal Bank of Scotland and Safeway with Abbey National.
Sainsbury's bank gained its licence to operate earlier this month.
